title: How to Make a Shrimp Pie

steps.headline: Prick the pie crust using a fork.
Place the pie crust on a baking sheet.
steps.description: Let it bake for about 9-11 minutes, until it's lightly golden brown.

steps.headline: Slice the shrimp into small chunks using a knife.
Cook the shrimp over medium heat on a large saucepan.
steps.description: Drizzle the olive oil over the shrimp and have it cook until the shrimp is pink, taking about 7-10 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the shrimp from the heat and allow it cool on a plate covered with a napkin.
In a separate medium-sized bowl, beat the cream cheese using a whisk or electric mixer.
steps.description: Beat until the cream cheese is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Crack in the eggs, one at a time.
steps.description: Continue to mix until well-combined and there are no egg streaks.

steps.headline: Fold in the shrimp and shredded cheese.
Pour the cream cheese filling into the pie crust.
steps.description: Spread it using a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Bake the pie in the oven for about 30-35 minutes, until the pie is golden brown and has fully baked.
Remove the pie from the oven and allow it to cool for about 15 minutes.
Serve.
steps.description: Slice the pie using a cutting knife. Lay a piece on a serving plate and garnish with chopped chives if desired. Enjoy!

text: Preheat oven to 375° Fahrenheit (190° Celsius).  Prick the pie crust using a fork.  Place the pie crust on a baking sheet. Let it bake for about 9-11 minutes, until it's lightly golden brown. Slice the shrimp into small chunks using a knife.  Cook the shrimp over medium heat on a large saucepan. Drizzle the olive oil over the shrimp and have it cook until the shrimp is pink, taking about 7-10 minutes. Remove the shrimp from the heat and allow it cool on a plate covered with a napkin.  In a separate medium-sized bowl, beat the cream cheese using a whisk or electric mixer. Beat until the cream cheese is light and fluffy. Crack in the eggs, one at a time. Continue to mix until well-combined and there are no egg streaks. Fold in the shrimp and shredded cheese. Mix again until properly combined. Pour the cream cheese filling into the pie crust. Spread it using a rubber spatula. Bake the pie in the oven for about 30-35 minutes, until the pie is golden brown and has fully baked.  Remove the pie from the oven and allow it to cool for about 15 minutes.  Serve. Slice the pie using a cutting knife. Lay a piece on a serving plate and garnish with chopped chives if desired. Enjoy!
